result.execSummary:
The defendant Samantha C Krosnicki was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Samantha C Krosnicki is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Samantha C Krosnicki was found guilty of Possession of THC [Modifiers: on or near Certain Places, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Samantha C Krosnicki was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes:
--to pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge

**Pursuant to the Court of Appeal decision in State v. Edward, 2015 WI 51, 363 Wis.2d 628 and State v. Radaj, 2015 WI 50, 363 Wis.2d 633, and 973.13, Stats., the JOC is amended to remove the DNA surcharge(s).  Government entities shall, to the extent legally obligated to do so, comply with the courts Order to Amend Judgment of Conviction Re: DNA Surcharge(s) entered herein.**

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to maintain absolute sobriety: no possession or consumption of alcohol; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to take all prescriptions as prescribed
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--to perform 100 hours of Community Service
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment,  and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to submit to random drug screen
--no contact with any known drug-offender except for treatment purposes, except for incidental contact for work and education purposes as approved by the Agent, and except that contact with Jesus Garcia Torres will be as allowed by the Agent
--to maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
The Court orders zero days drivers license suspension.

The Court orders that, upon successful completion of the Probation term, this record shall be expunged. The Court adds to the statutory definition of "successful completion" of Probation, that there be needs to be no alternatives to revocation, no extension of Probation and no early termination of Probation.

Arresting Agency: JCSD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

05-20-2014 - The Court orders the Judgment of Conviction shall be modified to reflect the correct spelling of the defendants name Samantha, not Samatha

records.addlTxt: The Court orders the Judgment of Conviction shall be modified to reflect the correct spelling of the defendants name Samantha, not Samatha (with cover letter from ADA Hall)
Incorrect order w/cover letter submitted by the State
With elements criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.
From DOC requesting the defendants first name be corrected to reflect Samantha

case called at 8:43am. 
Defendant Samatha C Krosnicki in court with Attorney Samantha J Humes.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered on Counts #8, #9; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Ms. Krosnicki guilty of Counts #8 & #9, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court dismisses Count # 3 outright.

On both Counts #8 & #9, the Court withholds sentence, and places Ms. Krosnicki on Probation for 18 months year, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to maintain absolute sobriety: no possession or consumption of alcohol; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to take all prescriptions as prescribed
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--to perform 100 hours of Community Service
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment,  and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to submit to random drug screen
--no contact with any known drug-offender except for treatment purposes, except for incidental contact for work and education purposes as approved by the Agent, and except that contact with Jesus Garcia Torres will be as allowed by the Agent
--to maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to pay $50 in drug testing fees
--to pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge on each count ($886 total)


Days credit for time already served:  0  days
The Court orders zero days drivers license suspension.

The Court orders that, upon successful completion of the Probation term, this record shall be expunged. The Court adds to the statutory definition of "successful completion" of Probation, that there be needs to be no alternatives to revocation, no extension of Probation and no early termination of Probation.

The Court indicates that if the DNA surcharge is found to be unconstitutional, and the Defendant has not yet paid the surcharge, then the Judgment of Conviction is to be amended to remove the surcharge payment requirement.  If the DNA surcharge has been paid and the ruling that found the DNA surcharge unconstitutional directs the clerks to reimburse the amount paid, then the clerk is to refund the amount paid to the Defendant. If the reimbursement is not mandated, then the amount will be kept.
recess 8:59am.
Preliminary hearing on April 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 26, 2014 at 02:40 pm.
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Co-Defendants cases #14CF47, #14CF49,#14CF51 called at 11:02am. 
Co-Defendants Jacob J Jeske, Samantha Krosnicki and Jesus Garcia Torres are in court. 
ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Each Co-Defendant verifies that the address shown on the Criminal Complaint is correct.
Service of Complaint admitted by each Co-Defendant, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
Constitutional rights are given
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by the State and by all three Co-Defendants.

The Court requires, for each Co-Defendant, a $500 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no discussion of the facts of the case with Jacob Jeske or Jesus Garcia Torres
--absolute sobriety:  no possession or consumption of alcohol 
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--to take all prescribed medications only as prescribed
--no possession of drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription 
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--no
 acts or threats of violence 
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today for booking
recess 
11:14pm.
